US govt shutdown: How it may impact immigration, travel process
description: The US government shutdown has begun, creating uncertainty for immigration processes. While USCIS and most Department of State visa/passport services remain operational, the Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification has ceased all functions. This halt prevents the filing of crucial LCAs and PERM applications, significantly delaying H-1B and green card processes until the shutdown concludes.

Users choose based on specific needs like accessibility or global reach. Both apps offer unique strengths.

description: Delhi is the country's crime capital with 1508.9 IPC cases per lakh population, while Jharkhand reports the fewest. However, Jharkhand's murder rate is significantly higher than Delhi's and Kerala's, suggesting widespread under-reporting of other crimes. This disparity highlights better policing and rigorous crime reporting in states like Delhi and Kerala.

title: Karur stampede fallout: TVK suspends Vijay's rallies; sets norms for key leaders

The team's success hinges on these key performances.

title: H-1B visa fees: Jensen Huang reacts to US move; calls $100,000 charge ‘too high’
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang endorsed President Trump's H-1B visa reforms but warned the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive. He cautioned this steep cost could deter global tech talent and students, potentially driving investment away from the US. Huang stressed that attracting the "brightest minds" remains crucial for America's future, despite supporting immigration system overhaul efforts.
